meanings.sent1: The dinosaur had dentate jaws that could tear through tough plants.
meanings.sent2: The comb had a dentate edge that helped detangle hair easily.
meanings.sent3: The dentate design of the fence made it look like a row of sharp teeth.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as bright as a dentate row of pearls.
meanings.sent5: The dentate pattern on the fabric added a unique texture to the dress.

meanings.definition: Having a toothed margin or edge
meanings.sent1: The caterpillar had a dentate back that looked like tiny spikes.
meanings.sent2: The leaf had a dentate border that made it stand out in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The dentate appearance of the clouds reminded him of fluffy cotton candy.
meanings.sent4: The mountain range had a dentate silhouette against the setting sun.
meanings.sent5: The old key had a dentate edge that fit perfectly into the lock.
